definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Xu Leizhi in the changing shape, each trip has a different outfit.
sentences.chinese: 徐雷智在劇中造型多變，每次出行都有不同的行頭。

sentences.english: But the emperor’s new outfit has a few holes.
sentences.chinese: 但是這件皇帝的新行頭還是有些漏洞。

sentences.english: That could be why Hobgoblin is still using his outfit.
sentences.chinese: 這個就是爲什麼紅魔一直用他的那身行頭。

sentences.english: Let me look at you, girl. Where'd you get those gorgeous togs ?
sentences.chinese: 讓我看看妳，女人，妳在哪裏買到這麼美麗的行頭？

sentences.english: Look at this outfit I'm wearing.
Large brooches figured heavily into the formula, as well.
sentences.chinese: 大號的胸針也包括在這套行頭中。

sentences.english: You can put on a stylish watch to match your hippest outfit for a party.
sentences.chinese: 你可以戴上流行的錶款，跟最時髦的派對行頭作搭配。

sentences.english: Five of this went to pay the regular installment on the clothes she had to buy.
sentences.chinese: 其中的5塊錢被用來付她非買不可的行頭的分期付款。

sentences.english: The clothes, she told reporters, had been birthday presents from friends.
sentences.chinese: 馬魯格對記者稱這身行頭都是朋友送她的生日禮物。

sentences.english: When that happens, what impression will your wardrobe make?
sentences.chinese: 到那時，你的行頭將給別人留下什麼樣的印象呢？

sentences.english: Gemini goes around the neighborhood once, changes costumes and goes around again.
sentences.chinese: 雙子座每去鄰居家一次就換一套行頭。

definition: to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
silver currency/currency of the Qing dynasty based on the silver tael 兩|两
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
not care about one's appearance (idiom)/slovenly in dress and manner
lit. to thread a needle (idiom); fig. to act as a go-between
